alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 4:15AM PDT until March 15 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 630 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. There will be widespread ponding of water on area roadways, and flooding in low-lying areas, intersections and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain across much of the county. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of one half inch to one inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will continue to produce widespread ponding of water and flooding of low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Malibu, Acton, Burbank, Griffith Park, North Hollywood, Universal City, Pasadena, Hollywood, Van Nuys, Downtown Los Angeles, Beverly Hills, Alhambra, Encino, Northridge, Santa Clarita, Culver City and Inglewood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
